description:
'''Eurobeat''' refers to two styles of [[dance music]] that originated in [[Europe]]: one is a British variant of Italian [[Eurodisco]]-influenced [[dance-pop]], and the other is a [[hi-NRG]]-driven form of [[Italo disco]]. Both forms were developed in the 1980s.

Producer trio [[Stock Aitken Waterman]] and pop band [[Dead or Alive (band)|Dead or Alive]] made Eurobeat music more popular in the United States and Southeast Asia, where Eurobeat was historically marketed as [[hi-NRG]] (pronounced as "high energy"). For a short while, it also shared this term with early [[Latin freestyle|freestyle music]] and Italo disco.
